cars.name: Nissan Skyline GT-R (Hakosuka)
cars.description: Classic GT-R with a straight-6 engine, known for its aggressive boxy styling.

cars.name: Toyota Corolla AE86
cars.description: The legendary drift car, popularized by the anime Initial D.

cars.name: Honda Civic EG6
cars.description: Lightweight VTEC-powered hatchback loved by tuners.

cars.name: Datsun 240Z
cars.description: The iconic Fairlady Z, praised for its performance and affordability.

cars.name: Toyota 2000GT
cars.description: Japan’s first true supercar, co-developed with Yamaha. Sleek, rare (only 351 built), and famously featured in a James Bond film (You Only Live Twice).

cars.name: Mazda RX-7 FB
cars.description: Lightweight, affordable sports car with a rotary engine. The RX-7 became a JDM tuner icon and is loved for its handling.

cars.name: BMW E30 M3
cars.description: Homologation special for Group A racing. Sharp handling, boxy design, and a motorsport pedigree make it one of BMW’s most celebrated cars.

cars.name: Mercedes-Benz 300SL "Gulllwing"
cars.description: The first true supercar of the 1950s. Known for its signature gullwing doors and advanced (for its time) direct fuel injection.

cars.name: Porsche 911 Carrera RS 2.7
cars.description: Lightweight homologation special with the iconic "ducktail" spoiler. Considered one of the purest and most collectible 911s.

cars.name: Jaguar E-Type
cars.description: Enzo Ferrari once called it “the most beautiful car ever made.” A British sports car icon with elegance and speed.

cars.name: Ferrari 250 GTO
cars.description: The holy grail of classic cars. Built for GT racing, only 36 were made. Today, it’s one of the most valuable cars in the world.

cars.name: Toyota Supra Mk3
cars.description: A grand tourer with a turbocharged punch, predecessor to the iconic Mk4 Supra. Loved for its balance of comfort and performance.

cars.name: Nissan Silvia S13
cars.description: Lightweight, RWD coupe famous in drifting culture. Affordable tuner platform with a cult following.

cars.name: BMW E39 M5
cars.description: A “wolf in sheep’s clothing.” Comfortable executive sedan but with supercar performance. Often considered the best M5 ever.

cars.name: Mercedes-Benz 190E
cars.description: Compact executive sedan, famous for its 190E 2.3-16 and 2.5-16 Evolution versions that battled the BMW E30 M3 in DTM touring car racing. Sturdy, boxy, and now a cult classic.

cars.name: Mercedes-Benz 500E
cars.description: Co-developed with Porsche, who also hand-assembled it in Stuttgart. Wider track, flared arches, uprated brakes, and suspension for handling. Looks like a regular W124 to the untrained eye, but it was a “wolf in sheep’s clothing” that could keep up with Ferraris and Porsches of its era. Today, it’s one of the most desirable classic Mercedes performance sedans.
